name: Electro Regisvine
desc:
A huge vine that has morphed into a monster through the conduction of high-voltage currents through the Ley Lines.

Electricity surges constantly from its canopy like the unending rage of the earth itself.

Kshahrewar researchers once submitted that a complex circuit matrix might be set up around this creature to carry electrical energy to the city for use there. This plan was stridently opposed by scholars from Spantamad, who sacrificed 10 Shroomboars to drive home the point about the dangers of utilizing electricity.

dropMaterial.name: Mora
dropMaterial.desc: Common currency. The one language everybody speaks.

dropMaterial.name: Thunderclap Fruitcore
dropMaterial.desc:
The core of an Electro Regisvine, wrapped in razor-sharp leaves, wantonly emits Electro energy.

The roaring energy rampaging deep within the earth is eager to pour out its rage, thus even tainting these unfortunate vines with its mania, causing them to wail and flail their branches frantically. One can hardly tell whether it longs for others to taste the pain of being continously electrocuted and charred or if it is struggling, looking forward to its inevitable doom.

dropMaterial.name: Vajrada Amethyst Fragment
dropMaterial.desc:
Character Ascension material.
"This body is the noblest and most eminent of all in this world."

dropMaterial.name: Vajrada Amethyst Chunk
dropMaterial.desc:
Character Ascension material.
"This body is the noblest and most eminent of all in this world.
It should hold absolute control over this world."

dropMaterial.name: Vajrada Amethyst Gemstone
dropMaterial.desc:
Character Ascension material.
"This body is the noblest and most eminent of all in this world.
"It should hold absolute control over this world.
"It once promised its people a dream: the never-changing 'eternity.'"

customize.text: A predatory plant in the same vein as the Cryo and Pyro Regisvines, this creature can create an organ that resembles <color=#ffe14b>Electro Cores</color> at its roots or corolla. When this type of organ starts to shift, its state will change, condensing into either a Waxing Stamen or a Waning Stamen. When the two types of stamens are present at the same time, they will <color=#ffe14b>attract one another and then unleash a powerful electrical explosion when they make contact</color> . Destroying these stamens quickly is key to an easier battle experience.

<color=#ffd780>When Autumn and Dew Meet</color>
Let the Electro Regisvine perform its charged electrical collision.

customize.name: Primogem
customize.desc: A primordial crystalline gem that's beyond the mundane world. Shines with the condensed hopes and dreams of universes that once were.

customize.text:
<color=#ffd780>The Mad Flower at the End of the Road</color>
When the Electro Regisvine emits a beam of thunderous light, paralyze it by attacking its corolla.

customize.name: Primogem
customize.desc: A primordial crystalline gem that's beyond the mundane world. Shines with the condensed hopes and dreams of universes that once were.

customize.text:
<color=#ffd780>Electric Shock Hazard</color>
Defeat an Electro Regisvine in Co-Op Mode.

customize.text: Sumeru Adventure Journal Vol. 4: New Creatures and Enemies

<color=#ffd780>August 19, 2022</color>
Hello, Travelers~ In the nation of flora and foliage, Sumeru, there are new creatures and enemies waiting to be discovered by you.
<color=#ffacff>HoYoLAB:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/www.hoyolab.com/article/7077609</color>

<color=#ffd780>August 23, 2022</color>
Hello Travelers~
The "Graven Innocence" event has started. In "Roaming the Jungle: Behemoth Observation," Travelers will face two all-new enemies: the Electro Regisvine and Jadeplume Terrorshroom. What unique features do they have? How should they be defeated? Let's take a look~
<color=#ffacff>HoYoLAB:</color> <color=#37ffff>https:/www.hoyolab.com/article/7155085</color>
